headline.main: CATHOLIC VETERANS AT SPECIAL MASS; 3,000, With Women's Auxiliary, Parade to St. Patrick's for Armistice Services WALSH DEFENDS CHURCH University Official Denounces 'Whisperings' That It Is Secret 'Friend' of Nazis, Fascists

lead_paragraph: Three thousand Catholic War Veterans of America and members of its Ladies Auxiliary, who marched in Fifth Avenue to St. Patrick's Cathedral yesterday for their seventh annual armistice memorial mass, heard the Rev. Edmund A. Walsh, vice president of Georgetown University and regent of the School of Foreign Service, denounce a "whispering campaign of innuendoes" that the Catholic Church is the "secret friend" of nazism and fascism because she condemns communism.
abstract: Cath War Veterans memorial mass, N Y C; illus
